alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 23 at 2:15AM MST until July 23 at 3:45AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northwestern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Imperial County in southeastern California... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 345 AM MST/345 AM PDT/. * At 215 AM MST/215 AM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 8 miles north of Brenda to 9 miles southwest of Midland to near Desert Center, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 1 and 46. CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 74 and 156. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 15. Locations impacted include... Yuma, El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Imperial, Somerton, Parker, Chiriaco Summit, Plaster City, Martinez Lake, Salton City, Desert Center, Ocotillo, Gadsden, and Fortuna Foothills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
